item.title: Notes on the Design of Go
item.description: Refusing new features Avoid leaky abstraction as much as possible. If an abstraction is not solid enough, you’d rather not use them at all. Go is designed like this, the features are carefully selected. If a feature is not solid enough, it will not be allowed to enter Go. No implicit string concatenation Rob: That used to be in the language but was dropped when the semicolon insertion rules went in.
